answers.answer: Your weight loss averages out to slightly over 5 pounds/month, so that's not too bad; the concern is if you didn't do anything to lose it.I've heard that depo can cause weight gain, so that could have something to do with it; however, maybe you should get tested for diabetes and hyperthyroidism to make sure there's not a medical reason for the weight loss.

question: hi, i used to weigh 186lbs in october 2010. I am happy with the results and think i wanna lose another 10 lbs.. i was just wondering since i weigh 135lbs now, people are saying that there worried about me, is it bad that i lost 49 lbs in that time spand from october  2010 - july 2011 ??, my appitite did go down a lot . but i don't starve myself. and the other weird thing is, i haven't been doing ANYTHING to lose the weight it just came off, although i heard that since i was on depo provera from 13-18 which is a good chunk of years ... i am going to be 21 this year? I got off of depo i believe 2 years ago in november.  i'm not sure if this could be the problem??. before the birth control i used to be super skinny, like size zero. went to 186lbs while on depo..
title: weight lost
